title: BCG holds free medical camps in Chandpur, Bhola
body: The Bangladesh Coast Guard organised two free medical camps in Chandpur and Bhola on Thursday, providing healthcare services and medicines to hundreds of low-income residents in coastal areas. Two separate press releases, signed by BCG media officer Lieutenant Commander Siam-ul-Haq, issued in this regard. BCG station Chandpur held a medical campaign at the Nayani Lakshipur outpost under Haimchar police station from 10:00am to 3:00pm. At the camp, 450 poor and distressed people, including children, received free check-ups and essential medicines. The programme aimed to support communities with limited access to healthcare, said a press release. On the same day, coast guard base Bhola arranged a similar medical campaign under the theme ‘Youth Festival 2025’ at Bheduria Bank Hat High School in Sadar upazila. The camp served 370 people, offering medical consultations and free medicines. The coast guard has long been working to assist underprivileged communities in coastal and riverine regions through regular humanitarian and healthcare initiatives, said another release, adding that such public service activities would continue in the coming days.
